intro: Cyathoglottis candida, commonly known as the white-flowered Cyathoglottis, is a tropical plant belonging to the Araceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive spathe and spadix inflorescence, typical of many members of its family. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by a white, leaf-like structure called a spathe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is native to parts of Southeast Asia. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
